methodsClass.description: Appends indication that the link will open in a separate window to the aria label. components.name: SdsSelectionPanelComponent

inputsClass.name: currentSelection
inputsClass.description: Allows users to programatically select panel item. Can also be used to select initial panel

inputsClass.name: model
inputsClass.description: Model containing navigation links as well as a selection mode property. Navigation mode is implied if no selection mode is passed in

inputsClass.name: navigateOnClick
inputsClass.description: True if users would prefer to navigate on panel selection, false otherwise. Navigation feature is not supported on SELECTION mode. On NAVIGATION mode, this is enabled by default

outputsClass.name: panelSelected
outputsClass.description: Outputs a NavigationLink item when it is selected from the panel

components.templateData:
<ng-container *ngIf="model.selectionMode && model.selectionMode === 'SELECTION'; else selectionMode">
  <sds-selection-panel-selection-mode 
  [model]="model" 
  [currentSelection]="currentSelection"
  (panelSelected)="panelSelected.emit($event)">
  </sds-selection-panel-selection-mode>
</ng-container>

<!-- Default mode if no selectionMode is passed in -->
<ng-template #selectionMode>
  <sds-selection-panel-navigation-mode 
  [model]="model" 
  [navigateOnClick]="navigateOnClick" 
  [currentSelection]="currentSelection"
  (panelSelected)="panelSelected.emit($event)">
  </sds-selection-panel-navigation-mode>
</ng-template>

components.name: SdsTreeTableComponent

inputsClass.name: childrenLimit
inputsClass.description: Defines maximum number of children to show to the user IE - if a row has 20 children available, and childrenLimit value is 10, then the amount of children displayed to the user will be numChildrenToDisplay amount, and the rest is toggled behind a 'View All' button, This should be greater than or equal to numChildrenToDisplay

inputsClass.name: dataSource
inputsClass.description: Rows of table tada to display

inputsClass.name: displayColumns
inputsClass.description: Column header text

inputsClass.name: numChildrenToDisplay
inputsClass.description:
Number of children to Display to users if a row's children length exceeds childrenLimit. This should be less than or equal to childrenLimit

General Cases: If numChildrenToDisplay is 5, childrenLimit is 10, and row has 20 children 5 children will be shown and the remaining can be displayed through View All button

If numChildrenToDisplay is 5, childrenLimit is 10, and row has 10 children All 10 children will be displayed because the row's children does not exceed childrenLimit

If numChildren is 5, childrenLimit is 10, and row has 4 children All 4 children will be displayed because row's children does not exceed childrenLimit

outputsClass.name: rowExpanded
outputsClass.description: Emitted anytime a row 's expansion / collapse value changes

outputsClass.name: viewAll
outputsClass.description: Emitted for a row if there are more children to display and user clicked view all

propertiesClass.name: treetableRow
propertiesClass.description: Reference for content projection. User defined values for how to display each cell in a row

methodsClass.name: collapseAll
methodsClass.description: Public Interface - close all opened children

methodsClass.name: collapseRow
methodsClass.description: Public Interface - Collapse a single row given an id. The row's successors will also be collapsed

methodsClass.name: displayVerticalBorder
methodsClass.description: Defines whether or not to display vertical border from this row. Vertical borders generally start from the last child and extend to the parent. However, if we are truncating the number of children displayed, then the vertical border would need to start from the child we truncate at.

methodsClass.name: expandAll
methodsClass.description: Public interface - open all panels with children

methodsClass.name: expandRow
methodsClass.description: Public interface - expand a single row given an ID. The row's predecessors will also be expanded

inputsClass.name: ariaLabel
inputsClass.description: Aria label for tab header

inputsClass.name: disabled
inputsClass.description: Whether this tab panel is disabled for selection

inputsClass.name: id
inputsClass.description: The associated id of this tab panel

inputsClass.description: True if panel is currently selected. Only one tabpanel should be selected at a time

inputsClass.description: Header content for the tab panel. May be a string or a template

components.name: TabsComponent

inputsClass.name: automaticActivation
inputsClass.description: Enable automatic activation for tabs when cycling through tabs using Left or Right arrow keys. Automatic activated tabs will automatically be selected on focus as user presses left or right arrow to move through each tab. By default, tabs will need to be manually selected when using keyboard only by pressing either Enter or Space to select the focused tab

inputsClass.name: selectedTab
inputsClass.description: Currently selected tab for display.

inputsClass.name: tabClass
inputsClass.description: CSS styling class for tabs

outputsClass.name: selectedTabChange
outputsClass.description: Emits an event whenever a tab is selected by the user containing the selected TabPanelComponent. Please note that because this output contains Change suffix to the tabSelected input, users can 2-way bind to the selectedTab input

propertiesClass.name: focusedTab
propertiesClass.description: Currently focused tab - can differ from selected tab when tab panels are manually activated

methodsClass.name: changeSelectedTabPanel
methodsClass.description: Internal method to change currently selected tab panel and display another panel to the user. External components should not use this method, but rather two-way bind the selectedTab input and modify that value.

methodsClass.name: getNextTabLeft
methodsClass.description: Gets next tab panel to the left of currently selected panel when Left Arrow is pressed. Skips disabled panels until it finds next left panel that is not disabled

jsdoctags.comment: • List of TabPanelComponents in the tab group

methodsClass.name: getNextTabRight
methodsClass.description: Gets next tab panel to the right of currently selected panel when Right Arrow is pressed Skips disabled panels until it finds next right panel that is not disabled

jsdoctags.comment: • List of TabPanelComponents in the tab group

methodsClass.name: ngAfterContentInit
methodsClass.description: If user has not given any tabs to select initially, select the first tab panel.

methodsClass.name: ngOnChanges
methodsClass.description: Listens for programmatic change to selected tab. When a tab is changed programmatically, we must disable previously selected tab, set selected property of the new tab to true, and adjust bookkeeping values.

methodsClass.name: ngOnInit
methodsClass.description: Assigns selected tab value was given. Otherwise, the first tab panel in the list will be selected after content has initialized.

methodsClass.name: onKeyDown
methodsClass.description: Looks for Left and Right arrow presses and moves selected tab accordingly.

libs/packages/components/src/lib/testing.description: Patches an elements focus and blur methods to emit events consistently and predictably. This is necessary, because some browsers, like IE11, will call the focus handlers asynchronously, while others won't fire them at all if the browser window is not focused.
